snippet: The number of Americans claiming new jobless benefits fell to a four-year low last week, and the producer price index increased 0.4 percent last month, the government said.
abstract: Labor Department reports initial unemployment claims fell 14,000 to a seasonally adjusted 351,000 in latest week, a four-year low; reports seasonally adjusted Producer Price Index rose 0.4 percent in February, from 0.1 percent rise in January.
lead_paragraph: The number of Americans claiming new jobless benefits fell to a four-year low last week, and the producer price index increased 0.4 percent last month, the government said.

headline.main: Weekly Jobless Claims Fall as Producer Prices Increase
headline.print_headline: Weekly Jobless Claims Fall as Producer Prices Increase
